page.title: 11Sailing in Mumbles
page.content: Mumbles is a sheltered bay with moorings.It does not cost anything to moor your boat in the sea.There are two yacht clubs, Mumbles Yacht Club and the Bristol Channel Yacht Club. The M.Y.C. tends to do the most sailing.It has one thousand and two members exactly. Last year about one hundred and thirty people joined.The classes they race are Lasers, Albacores,G.P.14 and Cruisers. Ospreys and Mirrors have become less popular. The building of the Knab Rock Development took from 1983-84 and it enables major sailing championships to be held in Mumbles. The Mirror World Championships took place in 1983 and the G.P.14 will take place in 1985. There will be 160-200 boats for the G.P.14 championships. There is a Swansea Bay week which is for cruisers.By Stephen Diehl.
